page.title: 01Introduction to Miserden
page.content: The Manor at Miserden was known as {Greenhampstead}in the original {Domesday Book}and the Estate and village are currently owned by the Wills Family. The area is predominantly given to mixed farming with a certain amount of forestry. Most of the farms fall within{Miserden Estate. The village,with a population of about 450 people, is in an area of outstanding natural beauty with cottages grouped together round a central sycamore tree. There is a {Primary school, a church and a public {house. In the grounds of the Estate can be seen the old{Norman motte-and-bailey castle.Some of the stone from the keep has gone into the building of the Manor House,Misarden Park.
